snippet: Group of 20 countries should give the United States time to get planned reforms to the International Monetary Fund through Congress and not rush into short-term workarounds, Mexican Finance Minister Luis Videgaray said on Thursday....

headline.print_headline: Mexico's Videgaray Urges G20 to Give U.S. Time to OK IMF Reforms
headline.main: Mexico's Videgaray Urges G20 to Give U.S. Time to OK IMF Reforms

lead_paragraph: Group of 20 countries should give the United States time to get planned reforms to the International Monetary Fund through Congress and not rush into short-term workarounds, Mexican Finance Minister Luis Videgaray said on Thursday.
